{| class="infobox" style="width: 28em; font-size: 95%;" |- | colspan="2" style="text-align: center; font-size: 150%;" | '''Northern Iowa vs. Southern Illinois''' |- | '''Teams''' | [[Northern Iowa Panthers football|Northern Iowa Panthers]]
[[Southern Illinois Salukis football|Southern Illinois]] |- | '''Originated''' | 1965 |- | '''Series''' | Northern Iowa leads, 15â14 |- | '''Current Champion''' | Southern Illinois |- | '''Trophy''' | None |} {{Article for deletion/dated|page=DrakeâDayton football rivalry|timestamp=20111201212218|year=2011|month=December|day=1|substed=yes}} The '''Northern IowaâSouthern Illinois rivalry''' is the [[college football]] rivalry between the [[University of Northern Iowa]] and [[University of Southern Illinois]]. Both of the schools are in the [[Missouri Valley Football Conference]]. Together they combine to hold 21 of 34 possible MVFC titles, with Northern Iowa having 16 and Southern Illinois holding five. As of 2011, the [[Northern Iowa Panthers football|Northern Iowa Panthers]] and [[Southern Illinois Salukis football|Southern Illinois Salukis]] have met 30 times, beginning in 1965. The Northern Iowa-Southern Illinois game alternates between being played at [[Saluki Stadium]] in even-numbered years and [[UNI-Dome]] in odd-numbered years. ==History== Northern Iowa has a 12-3 record in home games and a record of 4-11 in away games. Southern Illinois has a record of 11-4 in home games and a record of 3-12 in away games. ==Game results== ''Northern Iowa victories are shaded ââ purple. Southern Illinois victories are shaded ââ maroon.'' {| class="wikitable sortable" !
